channel.title: Combined Politepol Feed
channel.description: Merged feed from multiple Politepol sources

item.title: Men vs Women: Who needs to exercise more and why?
Is India mulling visa-on-arrival for medical tourists from US, Europe?
Is Jack Ma planning to leave China?
Trump vs BBC: Will US president's defamation case hold up in court?
How tattoos and clothes help families identify their loved ones in Delhi blast
Do you have a ‘Certified Bangers’ badge on X? Here’s what it means
Delhi blast underscores India’s escalating terror threat despite security gains
item.description: India can no longer just ‘mow the lawn’ against terrorism. It’s time for the country to change the rules of the counterterror game.

item.title: If America’s debt bubble bursts, here’s India’s smart path to economic dominance
item.description: The US’s $38 trillion debt crisis could reshape global power, but India must adopt free-market strategies to propel its economy forward

item.title: Beyond a ceremonial first, President Murmu’s Angola visit rejuvenates India’s Africa outreach
item.description: As India prepares to host the next India-Africa Forum Summit, Angola’s proactive engagement signals a renewed chapter in the collective story of India and Africa—one that blends the solidarity of past with the shared aspirations of a new global future

item.title: How Nyoma airfield in Ladakh marks a military aviation milestone for India
item.description: Nyoma offered the best bowl in the hills for building the airfield for fighter operations, adding a major airhead that greatly reduces reaction time

item.title: Rare earths are a strategic resource for 21st century: India must capitalise on its potential
item.description: While a fully diversified global market for rare earth minerals remains a long-term goal, the next decade will see significant state-backed investment in alternative supply chains, ensuring rare earths remain at the forefront of international relations and security policy

item.title: India’s Bahubali moment: Building space power for next-gen warfare
item.description: India is building formidable military space infrastructure, recognising that the next major conflict may well be decided not on terrestrial battlefields, but in space
